name: ServiceManager$ServiceStatus
description: The ServiceStatus enum represents the possible states of a service within the JsMacros ServiceManager system. Each status value provides information about both the enabled state and running state of a service.
overview:
The ServiceStatus enum provides a standardized way to track and query the state of services. Services can be independently enabled/disabled (which determines if they should run) and running/stopped (which indicates if they are currently executing). This dual-state system allows for services to be temporarily stopped without being disabled, or to be enabled but not currently running due to errors or manual intervention.

Enum Values:

- ENABLED: Service is enabled and currently running. (Enabled: true, Running: true)
- DISABLED: Service is disabled and stopped. (Enabled: false, Running: false)
- RUNNING: Service is running but marked as disabled. (Enabled: false, Running: true)
- STOPPED: Service is stopped but marked as enabled. (Enabled: true, Running: false)
- UNKNOWN: Service doesn't exist or status cannot be determined.

Status Transitions:
Services can transition between different states based on user actions or system events. Normal transitions include toggling between ENABLED/DISABLED or STOPPED/ENABLED. Special transitions occur when manually starting disabled services or when services crash.
